The claim originated from a Facebook pos: known for writing satirical pieces for the "Borowitz Report" published by The New Yorker.
The quote attributed to Sarah Palin: stating that the U.S. had "already attacked Iran back when it called itself Iraq," was a humorous spoof and not a genuine statement made by Palin.
The similarity in names and geographical: along with Palin's reputation for being less knowledgeable in foreign affairs, likely contributed to the creation and spread of the satirical quote.
The lack of a link to an underlying sati: s Facebook post confused some viewers unfamiliar with his work, leading to the misunderstanding and misinterpretation of the quote.
